DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Neoplasm First Not Hepatic Recurrent Disease Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the patient has been diagnosed with a first non-hepatic recurrence of a colorectal tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Neoplasm First Not Hepatic Recurrent Disease
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the first return of signs and symptoms of colon or rectum cancer after a period of improvement, not involving the liver.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Refers to the liver.:the return of a sign, symptom, or disease after a remission.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Pertaining to, affecting, or associated with the liver.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
